skill.name: dependency-audit-assistant
skill.description: Reviews package dependencies for security vulnerabilities, outdated versions, and license compliance. Use when user asks about dependencies, security audits, or before releases.
skill.summary: Reviews package dependencies for security vulnerabilities, outdated versions, and license compliance...
skill.author: CrazyDubya

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate dependency auditing skill consisting of documentation and a license-checking shell script. The script runs standard package manager commands (npm, pip, bundle, go) for license detection, which is appropriate for its stated purpose. No malicious behavior or data exfiltration detected.

content.user_title: Audit Dependencies for Security and Licenses
content.value_statement: Projects accumulate vulnerabilities in dependencies over time. This skill audits packages for security issues, outdated versions, and license compliance across npm, pip, bundler, and go modules.
actual_capabilities: Detects package manager type from project files
Runs security audit commands for multiple ecosystems
Identifies outdated packages by severity level
Reviews licenses and flags GPL/AGPL issues
limitations: Does not automatically update vulnerable packages
Does not fix license compliance issues
Requires appropriate tools installed (npm, pip, etc.)
Does not scan container images or binary dependencies

use_cases.title: Pre-release Security Checks
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive audits before deploying to production. Identify critical vulnerabilities requiring immediate attention.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Integration
use_cases.description: Audit dependencies during build processes. Generate reports for compliance and security documentation.

use_cases.title: License Compliance Review
use_cases.description: Identify GPL/AGPL dependencies that may conflict with project licensing. Find alternatives for problematic packages.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a dependency audit on this project. Check for vulnerabilities, outdated packages, and license issues.

prompt_templates.title: Security Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all security vulnerabilities in the dependencies. Prioritize by severity and provide fix recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: License Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check all dependency licenses. Flag any GPL, AGPL, or unknown licenses that may cause compliance issues.

prompt_templates.title: Full Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete dependency audit report including: vulnerability count by severity, outdated packages list, license summary, and prioritized action items with commands to run.

output_examples.input: Run a dependency audit on this project
output: License Issues: 2 packages with unknown licenses
Top Priority: Update lodash@4.17.15 to fix prototype pollution (CVE-2020-8203)

best_practices: Run audits regularly, not just before releases
Address critical and high vulnerabilities immediately
Test all updates in staging before production deployment
Document decisions about accepted risks or pinned versions
anti_patterns: Updating major versions without reviewing changelogs
Skipping audits due to time pressure

faq.question: Which package managers are supported?
faq.answer: npm, Yarn, pnpm, pip, Poetry, Bundler, Maven, Gradle, Go modules, Cargo, and Composer.

faq.question: How are vulnerabilities prioritized?
faq.answer: By CVSS severity: Critical, High, Moderate, Low. Exploitability and exposure context are also considered.

faq.question: Can this skill fix vulnerabilities automatically?
faq.answer: No. It provides the commands to run (like npm audit fix) but you must execute them and verify results.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads package manifest files and runs read-only audit commands against your dependencies.

faq.question: What if no package manager is detected?
faq.answer: The skill will report that no recognized package files were found and suggest supported formats to check.

faq.question: How does this compare to Snyk or Dependabot?
faq.answer: This skill provides quick audits using built-in tools. For continuous monitoring and advanced features, use dedicated services like Snyk or GitHub Dependabot.
